definition: to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to know/to be aware
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: This is what I meant by, see possibility and advance, knowing difficulty and withdraw.
sentences.chinese: 這就是所謂，見可而進，知難而退。

sentences.english: I think it is quit small ants.
sentences.chinese: 我以爲這隻小螞蟻是知難而退。

sentences.english: You should tell him you're busy, or just politely brush him off.
sentences.chinese: 老實告訴他你很忙，或許可以讓他知難而退。

definition: to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details

to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to advise
to set a trap

display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
to disobey
to force someone to do something
to say good-bye/to bid sb farewell
